sentence.Network_en: "Do you play chess?" he asked, looking askance at Miguel.
sentence.Network_cn: “你会下棋吗？”他斜睨着米格尔问道。

sentence.Network_en: They have always looked askance at the western notion of democracy.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们一直都怀疑西方的民主观。

list.abs: 睨睥_百度百科 ... 睥睨[ look sideways] 睥睨[ look askance at;look at sb. disdainfully out of the corner of one's eye].
... Reminiscent of= remain of 回忆往事的，怀旧的，让人想起.. Askance /look askance at （不高兴地）侧目， （以怀疑的目光）注 …
He looked askance at the offer ., 他并不接受这个报价.
they looked askance at her suggestion ., 他们对她的建议不以为然.
My family looked askance when I ordered snails as a first course in the restaurant ., 当我在饭店里要的第一道菜是蜗牛时 , 全家都讨厌地看着我.

entry.def: If you look askance at someone or something, you have a doubtful or suspicious attitude towards them.

example.ex: They have always looked askance at the western notion of democracy.
example.tran: 他们一直都怀疑西方的民主观。

entry.def: If you look askance at someone, you look at them in a doubtful or suspicious way.

example.ex: 'Do you play chess?' he asked, looking askance at Miguel.
example.tran: “你会下棋吗？”他斜睨着米格尔问道。

means.word_mean: 1. (used especially of glances) directed to one side with or as if with doubt or suspicion or envy;

sentences.sentence: "her eyes with their misted askance look"- Elizabeth Bowen

means.word_mean: 2. with a side or oblique glance;

sentences.sentence: "did not quite turn all the way back but looked askance at me with her dark eyes"

auth_sentence.content: She was shocked and looked at me askance.
